column2: Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. You need two words each time.
column3:
I managed to get a ticket for the concert.

I succeeded {{c1::in getting}} a ticket for the concert.

column2: Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. You need two words each time.
column3:
I must speak to the manager. I insist.

I insist {{c1::on speaking}} to the manager.

column2: Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. You need two words each time.
column3:
I would never ask them for money.

I wouldn't dream {{c1::of asking}} them for money.

column2: Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. You need two words each time.
column3:
I don't really want to cook.

I don't feel {{c1::like cooking}}.

column2: Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. You need two words each time.
column3:
I might get a new a motorbike.

I'm thinking {{c1::of getting|about getting}} a new motorbike.

column2: Complete the second sentence so that it has the same meaning as the first. You need two words each time.
column3:
It will be nice to see you again.

I'm looking forward {{c1::to seeing}} you again.
